data.name: Epoch Date String
data.description:
All computers store time using a system clock, which counts the number of seconds since the epoch (Midnight January 1st 1970). Implement a class which translates the timestamp into the date. # Your Task Define a class whose constructor takes a timestamp as an argument. The class has one public method which returns the date as a string formatted as shown below: `Hr:Min:Sec Month day, Year` Eg. `00:00:00 January 1, 1970`
`13:53:02 February 4, 2017` All times are in 24-hour format. # Some Further Notes
  1. The correct length of a year is a little more than 365 days. For those of you who like trivia, the correct calendar includes a leap year every 4 years, and misses out 3 leap years every 4 centuries. These three leap years are the century years: 1900, 2000, etc. These years are only leap years if they are evenly divisible by 400. Thus, the year 2000 was a leap year but the years 2100 and 2200 will not be leap years.

  2. There is a problem known as the 2038 problem when the integer will overflow. Thus, that is the largest number you will get. You can read more about it here: Wikipedia Year 2038 problem

  3. Because the year 2000 was a leap year, you do not have to worry about those pesky leap years which get missed out.

  4. The input will be strictly positive.
